subject: Theories: Annotating Collections with @DataPoints, as well as arrays

messageBody:
When using the experimental "Theories" feature in the current version of
JUnit, you can annotate any array with "@DataPoints" so that all the
elements of that array will be fed into methods annotated with "@Theory",
provided that the types match. But you cannot do the same for a List, or any
other kind of Collection, as I described at
http://stackoverflow.com/questions/2967912/junit-theories-why-cant-i-use-lists-instead-of-arrays-as-datapointsand
also filed as an issue at
http://github.com/kentbeck/junit/issues/issue/110

I've managed to hack together a solution, which you can see in my fork of
the project at http://github.com/MatrixFrog/junit and I would encourage any
comments or suggestions you have to improve it. To see how it works, run the
test case org.junit.tests.experimental.theories.runner.DataPointsTest

I hope this can eventually become part of the official JUnit project.
Thanks!
